At 20:50 27/09/2005, you wrote:
>Using a population of 1000 and counting 1000 births as one "generation".  I
>have reached a TTT-PPS(legal-nl) score of 0.897129 in 350 generations.  I
>am tempted to call this "89.7% perfect" but that would be very naive :)
>
>How does it play?  I'll tell you when I've written the "now play against a
>human" code.
>
>         Ian

Oh, this is 350,000 individuals in total, each one requiring _at_least_ 627 
board evaluations (this is Normalised TTT-PPS(legal-nl), canonical would be 
impractical.  Each time I trim the dead wood, I need another 5 or so passes 
through 627 boards per individual.  So far it's taken about 6.5 hours.  So 
it's not blindingly fast, but not impossibly slow either.  Improvements 
have slowed to only about once every 50 generations now, however...

         Ian
In 15 minutes everybody will be in the future.
